 Asks the GroupingAssistant to stop his work as soon as possible.

Detailed Description

Evaluates the fit of the CEM algorithm by computing the probability of missclassification.

All the features are use, all PCs except the time. Classifies points in the features as belonging to a mixture of Gaussians which are specified by the example data features and list of clusters.

Author:
Lynn Hazan
Since:
klusters 1.1

Member Function Documentation

Array< double > * GroupingAssistant::computeMeanProbabilities ( Data &  clusteringData,
QValueList< int > &  clusterList,
QValueList< int > &  computedClusterList,
QValueList< int > &  ignoreClusterIndex 
)

Evaluates the fit of the CEM algorithm by computing the probability of missclassification.

Computes the mean probabilities that spike of cluster c1 actually belongs to c2.

Parameters:
clusteringData object containing all the document data.
clusterList output paramater to return the list of clusters computed sorted like in the return array.
computedClusterList output paramater to return the list of actually computed clusters sorted like in the return array.
ignoreClusterIndex list of the indexes of the clusters which where not computed, either because they do not have enough spikes or their determinant could not be calculated (their covariance matrix is not positive definite.)
Returns:
nbSpikes x nbClusters array giving the posterior probabilities of belonging to each cluster of Fet2, for each point of Fet1.
